market_summary: XRP down 4.4% to $1.36 amid extreme fear (F&G: 5). ETF outflows continue with -$7.9k daily, -$5.5M weekly. USD/JPY stable at 155.21 near elevated stress threshold.
thesis_pulse: SBI Holdings launches ¥10B blockchain bond with XRP rewards - significant institutional momentum in Japan thesis pillar. ETF flows remain concerning with persistent outflows but AUM holding above $1.1B. RLUSD circulation at $1.56B shows 31% progress toward $5B kill switch target. Extreme fear environment (F&G: 5) creates noise but institutional adoption signals remain strong.

stress_assessment.interpretation: USD/JPY at 155.21 approaches elevated threshold. JGB 10Y at 2.24% exceeds critical level (>2%). Extreme fear at F&G: 5 compounds stress environment but oil at $69.77 remains moderate.

scorecard_updates.reasoning: SBI Holdings ¥10B blockchain bond with XRP rewards represents material institutional integration beyond previous status

alerts.message: SBI Holdings launches ¥10B blockchain bond with XRP rewards - strengthens Japan institutional thesis
Persistent ETF outflows continue: -$5.5M weekly net flow across 7 funds
JGB 10Y yield at 2.24% exceeds critical threshold of 2%

etf_analysis: Concerning outflow trend continues with -$7.9k daily, -$5.5M weekly across 7 funds. Only Canary Capital (XRPC) showing activity, all others flat, suggesting institutional hesitation despite $1.1B AUM holding.
macro_analysis: Stress environment persists with USD/JPY near 155 threshold and JGB yields above critical 2% level. Extreme fear (F&G: 5) reflects broad risk-off sentiment while oil remains contained at $69.77.

recommended_probability_adjustment.reasoning: SBI blockchain bond strengthens institutional case, shifting 5% from base to mid scenario despite ETF outflow concerns

events_draft.title: SBI Holdings Launches ¥10B Blockchain Bond With XRP Rewards
events_draft.expanded: Major Japanese financial institution deepens XRPL integration with blockchain-based security token offering XRP rewards. Strengthens Japan adoption thesis pillar with concrete institutional utility beyond ODL.

geopolitical_watchlist.status_text: JGB 10Y at 2.24% exceeds critical threshold amid continued yen weakness at USD/JPY 155.21
Strait of Hormuz tensions persist with dual carrier groups and Iran-Russia-China naval exercises
Trade tensions remain elevated under Section 122 tariff framework
10% global tariffs under Section 122 authority with ~150-day expiration window through July 2026
Coordinated exercises with Iran-China naval forces signal continued alliance strengthening

energy_interpretation: Brent crude at $69.77 remains below elevated threshold despite Hormuz tensions. Moderate oil prices limit Japan's trade deficit pressure, but USD/JPY weakness at 155.21 still strains BOJ credibility. JGB yields at 2.24% suggest bond market stress regardless of energy costs.
thesis_pulse_assessment: SBI Holdings ¥10B blockchain bond with XRP rewards marks significant institutional momentum in Japan pillar, moving beyond speculation to concrete integration. ETF outflows (-$5.5M weekly) signal short-term institutional hesitation but $1.1B AUM base holds. RLUSD at $1.56B shows steady 31% progress toward kill switch threshold. Extreme fear environment creates noise but underlying institutional adoption signals strengthen.
stress_interpretation: Elevated composite stress with JGB 10Y at 2.24% exceeding critical 2% threshold while USD/JPY at 155.21 approaches elevated boundary. Extreme fear (F&G: 5) amplifies risk-off sentiment. Oil containment at $69.77 prevents energy-driven escalation but Japan fiscal stress remains acute.

bear_case.score_reasoning: Persistent ETF outflows and extreme fear environment create headwinds, but institutional adoption signals like SBI blockchain bond limit counter-thesis pressure.

bear_case.bear_narrative: Persistent ETF outflows (-$5.5M weekly) suggest institutional confidence eroding despite positive headlines. Extreme fear environment (F&G: 5) indicates broader market stress that could overwhelm adoption narratives. BIS Project Nexus represents credible alternative settlement infrastructure that could bypass XRPL entirely.
